description: The "synthetic.product_categories" table represents a hierarchical structure of product categories, providing key attributes for each category such as name, description, and status, which can be used for organizing products in a retail or e-commerce context. The primary key, "category_id," uniquely identifies each category, and the optional "parent_category_id" allows for nesting of categories, indicating a parent-child hierarchy. Although currently not linked to other tables by foreign keys, this table is likely intended for categorizing products in another table within the database.

columns.name: category_id
columns.description: This column uniquely identifies each product category in the system with an incrementing numerical value. It ensures that every category has a distinct and definitive reference within the database.

columns.name: slug
columns.description: This column likely contains URL-friendly identifiers or keywords for different product categories, using hyphenated phrases to represent the category's identity or theme. Purpose unclear from available data.

columns.name: parent_category_id
columns.description: This column signifies the identifier of a higher-level category to which a product category belongs, allowing for a hierarchical categorization of products. Its usage helps in organizing categories under broader parent categories, although specific business logic or category names are not evidenced by the available data.

columns.name: description
columns.description: Provides narrative or promotional text related to specific product categories, potentially utilized for marketing or descriptive purposes. Purpose unclear from available data.

columns.name: image_url
columns.description: This column stores URLs linking to images associated with product categories, likely used for marketing or organizational purposes. The presence of domain names suggests a variety of potential sources for these images.

columns.name: sort_order
columns.description: This column represents the sequence in which product categories are displayed or processed, with higher values possibly indicating later positioning in a list or hierarchy. Purpose unclear from available data.

columns.name: is_active
columns.description: Indicates whether a product category is currently visible or usable within the system. A lack of consistent values suggests that both active and inactive statuses are common.

columns.name: meta_title
columns.description: This column appears to contain brief descriptive phrases or slogans that may relate to or categorize products. The phrases are abstract and general, suggesting they might serve as meta descriptions or tags for different product categories.

columns.name: meta_description
columns.description: This column likely contains succinct promotional or descriptive text for different product categories, intended to provide additional context or attract potential customers. The exact purpose remains unclear from the available data.

columns.name: created_at
columns.description: This column records the date and time when a product category was created within the database system. It captures this information by default at the time a new entry is made.

columns.name: updated_at
columns.description: This column records the date and time when the information related to product categories was last updated. Purpose unclear from available data.

indexes.index_definition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX product_categories_pkey ON synthetic.product_categories USING btree (category_id)
CREATE UNIQUE INDEX product_categories_slug_key ON synthetic.product_categories USING btree (slug)
